name: ddwCommon
summary: Various classes and extensions belonging to dewdrop_lib.Many other ddwlib classes depend on the code here.

name: ddwEQ
summary: Fully parametric EQ with GUI editor. Compatible with MixerChannels but may be used with other signal-routing schemes.

summary: Some new GUI features used by other parts of the library.
author: James Harkins

name: ddwLivecodeInstruments
author: James Harkins
summary: Ready-to-use instruments and processes for the ddwChucklib-livecode live-coding music system.

name: ddwMIDI
summary: A MIDI response framework. Used optionally by Voicers, Mixers and chucklib.
author: James Harkins

name: ddwMixerChannel
summary: General-purpose signal routing, mixing, with GUI mixing board.
author: James Harkins

name: ddwOSCSyncClocks
summary: Simple, minimalistic master-slave clock sync across the network

name: ddwPatterns
summary: Various new pattern classes and enhancements.

name: ddwPeakMonitor
summary: A simple graphic monitor that tracks the peak values of a signal. Useful to check for clipping
author: James Harkins

name: ddwPrototype
summary: Support for prototype-based programming.
author: James Harkins
James Harkins
name: ddwSensitivity
summary: A macro UGen that mimics the behavior of the 'sensitivity' control in many hardware synths.

name: ddwSnippets

summary: A GUI text box that mirrors messages displayed in the post window.
author: James Harkins
James Harkins
name: ddwTemperament
summary: Classes for temperaments other than 12ET.

name: ddwTimeline
summary: A timeline sequencing framework for pieces that require automated high-level control.NOTE: This code is still somewhat experimental.
author: James Harkins

name: ddwVoicer
summary: A voice-stealing note player, with GUI and controls shared across nodes.

name: dewdrop_lib
summary: The main container for dewdrop_lib. All the code exists in the other ddw Quarks; this Quark simply has the dependencies to install all the others automatically.

summary: Tools and UGens for live performance by Egregious

summary: A graphical representation of data where the values taken by a variable in a two-dimensional map are represented as colours.

name: redSampler
summary: Playback of soundfiles from disk or RAM. With simple envelope, voices and looping. The 'giga' sampler class (RedDiskInSamplerGiga) is useful for massive sample libraries that will not fit in RAM. It preloads a bit of the beginning of all the soudfiles and streams the rest from disk when needed.
author: redFrik
